article.title: Restarting activity in the nucleus of PBC J2333.9-2343: an extreme case of jet realignment

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the simultaneous spectral fitting of XMM-Newton spectra of PBC J2333.9-2343. What model best represents the data? (Figure 1)
choices: Power law with partial covering absorption

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of stellar population dominates the optical spectra of PBC J2333.9-2343 shown in this figure? (Figure 2)
choices: Stellar population dominated by blue supergiants

multiple_choice_question.text: These VLBA images of PBC J2333.9-2343 at 8, 15, and 24 GHz show a core and a jet. What does the brightness of the jet at different frequencies suggest about its emission? (Figure 3)
choices: The jet emission is dominated by thermal bremsstrahlung.
The jet emission is consistent with optically thin synchrotron emission.
The jet emission is consistent with free-free emission.
The jet emission is dominated by dust emission.

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula describes the relativistic Doppler factor (δ). What does a Doppler factor greater than 1 imply about the observed emission? (Formula: \u03b4 = [\u0393(1-\u03b2cos \u03b8)]¯¹)
